Title: Afternoon Delight
Address: 251 E Liberty St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Cozy, bustling eatery known for its eggs Benedict also boasts an extensive salad bar.

summary.snippet: "Comfy and cozy atmosphere, yummy yummy fruit plate"
"Well maintained dining area, friendliest staff and a bake shop in-house..."

most_relevant.description: Quite good. I would say get the eggs Benedict. Make sure to read the menu properly my friends got the pecan waffle but didn’t want to pay extra for toppings so it was a bare waffle LOLOLOL. Don’t really love the order at counter then sit down model but that how it be at a lot of brunch places in aa. Had to wait a long time in line.

Love love love this place. Been coming here since I was a baby. Homemade muffins daily. Everyday is a different flavor muffin. Veggie Morning Delight is amazing with their ranch dressing to dip it in.

Good food and good service. The wait on a Saturday around 11am was around 45 minutes-1 hour, so be aware you won’t get in and go. But the staff is friendly and the food is tasteful. Very close to other shopping attractions downtown, so in a convenient location! Would recommend eating lunch here.
Afternoon delight is so good. The food is always fresh and made to oder. The service is 5 stars, and the atmosphere is too. Breakfast or lunch, you can't go wrong if you pull up to Afternoon delight

Brunch is simply amazing here.  Baked goods are fresh and delicious.  Eggs are overflowing in the breakfast biscuit.  Belgian waffles have tons of fresh fruit and are filling.  The "small" fruit cup is actually quite large and has great variety.  Frankly, only downside is that it takes forever to order and get your food during peak times.  Servers and staff are friendly and working hard, but they just seem a little under staffed.  Still definitely recommend, but be prepared to wait in line.

We catered food for brunch (June 2024) and it was fantastic!  The food was delicious, exactly what was discussed in the order process, ready on time and the amounts were very generous,.  Everything was packed up perfectly, so all the food looked great as well.  All our guests raved about the taste – quiches were rich and creamy, pastries fresh and delicious.  I would highly recommend Afternoon Delight and will go out of my way to enjoy their food again!  Thank you!

We visited AD on a Sunday and weren't expecting the wait for close to 50 minutes! But I guess any place that has this long of a wait better be good and AD did not disappoint, at all! Everyone in our party of 5 enjoyed their main entrees except for the blueberry muffin (very dry) and seafood just doesnt jive with an omelet!! Service was a tad bit slow but that gave us more time with friends. Do try their shakes but be warned of their size!! In summary - An awesome brunch + lunch spot in A2. 5/5!

I was just there for takeout but would have loved to dine in the simple, stylish atmosphere. The staff are all friendly and helpful. The menu options are excellent. I ordered Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict with a Mocha Cappuccino shake, and for my fiancé the Tuna Melt with orange juice. Both were incredibly delicious. Obvious quality ingredients. I ran back in to leave a bigger tip after enjoying the meal so much.
